allow:
Bash(git commit -m "$(cat <<''EOF''
Add interactive web-based app simulator

Created comprehensive HTML simulator for TerrainIQ Dashcam app demonstrating all core functionality:

Features:
- Interactive controls for real-time simulation (distance, severity, speed, hazard type)
- Three view modes: Hazard HUD, HUD with PIP, Camera with Overlay
- Portrait/Landscape orientation toggle
- Auto-record and manual recording controls
- Motion detection simulation
- Annotations toggle for UI explanations

Three-tab interface:
- Controls: Interactive sliders and toggles
- Requirements: Complete documentation with feature badges
- Examples: 12 pre-configured usage scenarios with "Try It" buttons

Examples tab features:
- Portrait/Landscape/Both orientation toggle
- Scroll position memory when switching tabs
- "Try It" buttons load scenario configs into main simulator
- Full-screen display (hides phone simulator for more space)

Scenarios covered:
- Critical warnings (Level 10, 150m)
- Rough road sections (Level 8, 300m)
- Moderate hazards (Level 6, 500m)
- Minor hazards (Level 3, 450m)
- All clear states
- Stationary/stopped modes
- Camera view with overlay
- Picture-in-picture mode
- Landscape orientations
- Multiple hazards
- Manual recording override

Technical implementation:
- Single-file HTML with embedded CSS and JavaScript
- CSS Grid for responsive layouts
- Dynamic background colors based on severity (1=best, 10=worst)
- Smooth transitions between orientations
- Real-time UI updates

No build process or dependencies required - opens directly in browser.

ðŸ¤– Generated with Claude Code
EOF
)")

Bash(git commit -m "$(cat <<''EOF''
Update requirements with simulator documentation

Added comprehensive documentation for the interactive web-based simulator:

New sections:
- Interactive App Simulator overview
- Simulator features (controls, view modes, tab interface, responsive design)
- Usage instructions
- Testing checklist for simulator
- Future enhancements section with planned features

Simulator documentation includes:
- Interactive controls (distance, severity, speed, hazard type, recording, motion, orientation)
- Three view modes (HUD, HUD+PIP, Camera+Overlay)
- Three-tab interface (Controls, Requirements, Examples)
- 12 pre-configured scenarios with "Try It" functionality
- Scroll position memory and responsive design

Future enhancements documented:
- Screen navigation in examples (Hazard view, Camera view, Settings, Left Nav)
- Settings screen design specifications
- Left navigation menu structure
- Additional simulator features (map view, hazard reporting, statistics, multi-language)

Updated last modified date to 2025-10-12.

ðŸ¤– Generated with Claude Code

Co-Authored-By: Claude <noreply@anthropic.com>
EOF
)")

Bash(./kb add --title "Add screen navigation to simulator Examples tab" --description "Implement buttons to toggle between Hazard view, Camera view, Settings, and Left Nav screens for each scenario. Allow users to see how different screens would appear in each scenario configuration." --type feature --priority high --assignee agent)

Bash(./kb add --title "Design Settings screen layout" --description "Create Settings screen design with configuration options: proximity threshold, update frequency, hazard type filters, recording quality, MQTT settings, and About/Version info" --type feature --priority high --assignee agent)
